New Records: Pakistan recorded the highest successful run chase in Cricket World Cup history
Key Match Events: Centuries from Kusal Mendis (122) and Sadeera Samarawickrama (108) helped Sri Lanka set a total of 344 for nine
Abdullah Shafique (113) and Mohammad Rizwan (131 not out) hit centuries of their own to give their side a second successive victory in the tournament
The Pakistan fightback started through Shafique. The 113 runs he managed off 103 balls gave his side the momentum they needed facing such a big total
Rizwan, who hit 11 boundaries, rounded off a remarkable match as he struck the winning runs to confirm a historic victory
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan’s Abdullah Shafique and Mohammad Rizwan hit centuries of their own to give their side a second successive victory in the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sri Lanka opener Pathum Nissanka hit 51 off 61 deliveries, which made up for a duck by his partner, Kusal Perera
Nissanka’s quickfire half-century set the tone for a magnificent effort from Sri Lanka, hitting seven fours and a six in the process
Hasan Ali claiming four wickets for Sri Lanka
